title: 106_s2605
content: The Act titled "Commercial Fishermen Safety and Tax Fairness Act of 2000" allows income averaging for fishermen. The Act "Commercial Fishermen Safety and Tax Fairness Act of 2000" allows income averaging for fishermen by amending the Internal Revenue Code to include fishing business in the definition of elected farm income. The Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act defines commercial fishing conduct. SEC. 3. CREDIT FOR PURCHASE OF FISHING SAFETY EQUIPMENT. An amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 introduces a new section for a Fishing Safety Equipment Credit. The Fishing Safety Equipment Credit allows eligible taxpayers engaged in a fishing business to claim a credit of 75% of qualified fishing safety equipment expenses, not exceeding $1,500 per year. Eligible expenses include those for safety equipment used in connection with the fishing business. The Fishing Safety Equipment Credit pertains to lifesaving equipment required for vessels under US law. Special rules and aggregation rules apply, and no double benefit deduction is allowed. Basis adjustment is also considered for the credit. The Fishing Safety Equipment Credit allows for a basis adjustment of equipment when a credit is claimed. There is a limitation on carrying back the credit, and certain conforming amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code. The Fishing Safety Equipment Credit is amended to include a new paragraph in the general business credit section. Subsection (a) of the Internal Revenue Code is also amended to allow for equipment credits under section 45D. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for subpart D of the Code. The Fishing Safety Equipment Credit is amended by adding a new item to part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Fishing Safety Equipment Credit is amended by adding a new item to part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments made by this Act shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2000.
